filmography.title: Hamlet
filmography.role_description: A soldier and guard at Elsinore who is among the first to witness the ghost of Hamlet's father.
filmography.plot: Prince Hamlet struggles over whether or not he should kill his uncle, whom he suspects has murdered his father, the former King.

filmography.title: Saraband for Dead Lovers
filmography.role_description: A supporting role in this lavish Ealing Studios costume drama about a tragic royal romance.
filmography.plot: A young woman marries a German prince for political reasons but falls in love with a dashing Swedish count.

filmography.title: Oh... Rosalinda!!
filmography.role_description: A Russian general in this modern Technicolor adaptation of the operetta 'Die Fledermaus' by Powell and Pressburger.
filmography.plot: In post-war Vienna, four occupying powers and a host of characters engage in a romantic farce centered around a masquerade ball.

filmography.title: The Battle of the River Plate
filmography.role_description: The British naval officer commanding the squadron that hunts down the German pocket battleship Graf Spee.
filmography.plot: The British Navy hunts down the German battleship Admiral Graf Spee off the coast of South America during WWII.

filmography.title: The Wrong Man
filmography.role_description: The determined defense attorney who tries to prove the innocence of a man falsely accused of robbery.
filmography.plot: In 1953, an innocent man is mistaken for an armed robber and caught up in the criminal justice system with spiraling consequences.

filmography.title: Woman in a Dressing Gown
filmography.role_description: A husband in a mid-life crisis who plans to leave his disorganized but loving wife for a younger woman.
filmography.plot: A middle-aged man plans to leave his slovenly wife for his secretary, but finds the decision harder than expected.
filmography.awards: Berlin Film Festival: Win – FIPRESCI Prize

filmography.title: Ice Cold in Alex
filmography.role_description: A mysterious South African officer who hitches a ride with a British ambulance crew across the desert; one of his most famous roles.
filmography.plot: A group of British medical personnel and a South African officer try to drive an ambulance across the North African desert during WWII.

filmography.title: Tarzan's Greatest Adventure
filmography.role_description: A ruthless British villain and diamond hunter who serves as a formidable antagonist to Gordon Scott's Tarzan.
filmography.plot: Tarzan pursues a gang of diamond hunters who killed two natives, leading to a deadly confrontation.

filmography.title: The Guns of Navarone
filmography.role_description: The British officer who organizes the commando mission but breaks his leg, forcing him to be left behind with the enemy.
filmography.plot: A British team is sent to cross occupied Greek territory and destroy the massive German gun emplacement that commands a key sea channel.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Motion Picture (Drama)

filmography.title: H.M.S. Defiant
filmography.role_description: A naval physician who supports the captain against a sadistic executive officer during the Napoleonic Wars.
filmography.plot: A British naval captain contends with a cruel second-in-command and a crew on the verge of mutiny.

filmography.title: Lawrence of Arabia
filmography.role_description: A British liaison officer who advises and observes Lawrence, representing the traditional military establishment.
filmography.plot: The story of T.E. Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and led the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War I.

filmography.title: The Fall of the Roman Empire
filmography.role_description: A gladiator and devoted bodyguard to the Emperor Commodus, who reveals a shocking secret about the Emperor's lineage.
filmography.plot: The death of Marcus Aurelius leads to a succession crisis between his corrupt son Commodus and his loyal general Livius.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Original Score

filmography.title: East of Sudan
filmography.role_description: A British soldier who helps escort a group of civilians to safety during the Mahdist War in Sudan.
filmography.plot: During the 1880s Arab revolt in Sudan, a British trooper tries to lead a small group of refugees to safety.

filmography.title: Operation Crossbow
filmography.role_description: A British intelligence officer involved in the mission to destroy Nazi long-range missiles.
filmography.plot: Allied agents are sent to infiltrate a Nazi rocket facility and destroy their new V-weapons.

filmography.title: A Study in Terror
filmography.role_description: A pioneering forensic doctor who assists Sherlock Holmes in his hunt for Jack the Ripper.
filmography.plot: Sherlock Holmes sets out to uncover the identity of Jack the Ripper, who is terrorizing London's East End.

filmography.title: Misunderstood
filmography.role_description: A busy British consul in Florence who struggles to connect with his two young sons after his wife's death.
filmography.plot: A grieving father fails to understand his elder son's need for affection while doting on his younger son.
filmography.awards: David di Donatello: Win – Best Foreign Actor (nom)

filmography.title: Mackenna's Gold
filmography.role_description: A polished English gentleman who joins the ragtag group searching for a legendary valley of gold.
filmography.plot: A marshal is kidnapped by an outlaw who forces him to lead a group to a legendary valley of gold.

filmography.title: Anne of the Thousand Days
filmography.role_description: The powerful Lord Chancellor who fails to secure King Henry VIII's divorce, leading to his downfall; earned him an Oscar nomination.
filmography.plot: King Henry VIII of England discards one wife, Katharine of Aragon, for a new love, Anne Boleyn.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Everything You Always Wanted to Know About Sex
filmography.role_description: A cameo as a Renaissance King in the segment 'What Happens During Ejaculation?'.
filmography.plot: A series of vignettes exploring various aspects of sexuality, directed by Woody Allen.

filmography.title: The Tamarind Seed
filmography.role_description: A British intelligence chief who monitors a romance between a British woman and a Soviet attaché.
filmography.plot: A British Home Office assistant and a Soviet official fall in love, complicating international relations during the Cold War.

filmography.title: Great Expectations
filmography.role_description: The imposing lawyer who manages Pip's affairs and knows the secret of his benefactor.
filmography.plot: A humble orphan suddenly becomes a gentleman with the help of an unknown benefactor.

filmography.title: The Eagle Has Landed
filmography.role_description: The head of German military intelligence who reluctantly authorizes the mission to kidnap Winston Churchill.
filmography.plot: A German plot to kidnap Winston Churchill unfolds at the height of World War II.

filmography.title: Holocaust 2000
filmography.role_description: A scientist who warns of the apocalyptic dangers of a new nuclear power plant design.
filmography.plot: An executive discovers his son is the Antichrist, who plans to use nuclear power to bring about the apocalypse.

filmography.title: Murder by Decree
filmography.role_description: The Commissioner of Police who obstructs Sherlock Holmes' investigation into the Jack the Ripper murders.
filmography.plot: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. Watson hunt for Jack the Ripper, uncovering a conspiracy that leads to the highest levels of the British government.

filmography.title: Buster
filmography.role_description: The justice who presides over the trial of the Great Train Robbers; one of Quayle's final film roles.
filmography.plot: The story of Buster Edwards, one of the thieves involved in the Great Train Robbery of 1963.
